entry.title: Fix for Octopress twitter plugin
entry.content:
After repeatingly detecting some JavaScript-Errors in Chrome’s Developer Console i tracked them down to the getTwitterFeed(user, count, replies) function in .themes/classic/source/javascripts/twitter.js.

Note: I’m using the classic theme at the time of writing.

The plugin uses values from _config.yml to assign them to variable user, count and reply, which were sent via an AJAX request to twitter’s REST api. But since there are no default-values defined count and replies are undefined or will be NaN in case of count.

All you need to do is to add the following variables to your _config.yml file.

twitter_tweet_count: 5
twitter_show_replies: true
twitter_follow_button: true

Now the variables can be defined and your twitter plugin is fixed and will show up properly in the sidebar.

Hope that helps and saves you some time.

regards
~ david
